intro: Octarrhena mendumiana, commonly known as the Mendum's octarrhena, is a species of flowering plant native to specific regions in East Africa. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in grasslands and open woodlands, adapting to semi-arid conditions. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its flowers are yellow with a prominent central disk. Octarrhena mendumiana is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and ecological role in its native habitat.
